links.*: J.R.R. Tolkien Encyclopedia: Scholarship and Critical Assessment
Tolkien and the Invention of Myth

wikitext.*:
'''Kathleen E. Dubs''' ([[1944]] - [[2011]]<ref>[[Jason Fisher]], "[http://lingwe.blogspot.com/2011/12/new-reviews-of-past-work.html New reviews of past work]" at [http://lingwe.blogspot.com/ Lingwë] (accessed 17 December 2011)</ref>) was a member of the humanities faculty at [[wikipedia:Pázmány Péter Catholic University|Pázmány Péter Catholic University]], and a member of the [[Hungarian Tolkien Society]]. Her courses included [[Old English|Old]] and [[Middle English]], medieval literature, and her lectures on [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] revived interest in him in academic circles.

==Bibliography==
===Books===
* [[2010]]: ''[[Middle-earth and Beyond|Middle-earth and Beyond: Essays on the World of J.R.R. Tolkien]]'' (edited with Janka Kaščáková)
===Articles===
* [[2004]]: ''[[Tolkien and the Invention of Myth]]''
** "Providence, fate, and chance: Boethian philosophy in the Lord of the Rings" 
* [[2006]]: ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien Encyclopedia: Scholarship and Critical Assessment]]''
** "Fortune and Fate"
